definition: to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: Trouble develops, however, when any human instinct or appetite causes overdeveloped.
sentences.chinese: 但假使人的欲求或喜好过度膨胀则会带来麻烦。

sentences.english: That full-size full-size business profits from the satisfaction of a human instinct is a common enough phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 大公司通过满足人的欲求而大赚其钱也正常不过。

sentences.english: Often laugh in fine feather for relaxing your body and mind.
sentences.chinese: 欲求身心自在，最好笑口常开。

sentences.english: Will is nothing but the last appetite or aversion remaining in deliberation.
sentences.chinese: 意志无非是深思熟虑中最后余留的欲求或厌恶。

sentences.english: Trouble develops, however, when any human instinct or appetite becomes overdeveloped.
sentences.chinese: 但假如人的欲求或喜好过度膨胀则会带来麻烦。

sentences.english: And he felt a surge in craving to go use.
sentences.chinese: 他还感觉到一种去过把瘾的强烈欲求。

sentences.english: In order to overcome them, one must keep faith.
sentences.chinese: 欲求经此磨难，则必须坚持信念，大众一心。

sentences.english: These new crops of movies have captured the emptiness of modern China and the longings of all humanity.
sentences.chinese: 这些新潮影片捕撷到现代中国的虚无和人类的欲求。

I want to work on foreigners family.
If you want peace, prepare for war.

definition: bottomless pit of desire (idiom); insatiable greed/carnal cravings are never satisfied and are a main obstruction on the path to enlightenment
to ask for sth and receive it/to try to obtain/to look for and obtain
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
